comment: So disorganized. Two different syllabi posted with conflicting information. Multiple versions of exams on the same due date and only one counted for a grade with no direction to which one was the correct test. Guided examples posted for each week with faulty links. Due dates all over the place. Never responded to any emails. Not a single lecture.

Makes lectures as interesting as he can but they're still pretty dry. Very fair attendance policy (allowed to skip 25% of classes). Operations Management has a big project that requires touring and auditing a manufacturing firm but you can't avoid that changing profs. Exams are super easy and through McGraw Hill Connect. Kind guy, would take again.

The exams and homework were easy enough, but the group project was difficult due to the requirements. Despite being online you have to go in person to tour a manufacturing plant, the list he provided was out of date, and none of the companies were willing to give us a tour. The only reliable way to reach the prof. is by text.

This class was super easy, the tests were all open note, and no lockdown. Each week we had smartbooks and quizzes on Connect. There were 3 tests and a major group project! Get started on it ASAP took me a while to get it set up. What I liked most about Professor Obeidat was he gave us all his phone #, in case we ever had an emergency with the exams

Very unorganized. He doesn't grade anything till the end of the semester. You also won't learn anything since he practically reads off the slides which makes class extremely boring and hard to attend.

I have taken this prof twice, once online and once hybrid. The classes were very easy but lots of busy work. If youre looking for an easy online class he might work for you, just beware he is extremely disorganized and does not grade anything until the end of the semester. If you are looking to learn from a class, dont take him.

Dont take this guy. He made no contact all semester aside from spending the first 3 weeks telling us that the class was in person when it was online. He never graded our assignments, just put our final grade in at the end of the semester. Easy grade but you arent going to learn a single thing. He put negative effort into teaching this class.

Average class. The only bad part was he put in grades literally the week after finals. I could feel when I did good on exams and hw. If you participated in the discussion and responded decently he gave me full credit for all. and you get your grade on your connect quizzes right after you take it. he is the best you go get at KSU for this class.

Not a hard professor, but confusing. Don't expect to know how you're doing in the class, he doesn't grade anything. Don't expect clear instructions on any assignment, even if you ask him directly it doesn't help. He did not realize our online class was online for a solid week. 

He's fine to take if you can coast on your own, just do the work.
Do not take this professor. Just don't.

He is very disorganized, but his class was the easiest class I have taken this semester. If you get your work done and turn it in, you will most likely end up with an A. The final project is kind of tricky because it uses a program we never used. His work is just busy work, and you can complete it earlier if you want to. Not too hard for an A!

This is the most disorganized class I've ever taken. Due dates on D2L are misleading as it doesn't track the discussion posts that are due on a weekly or the quizzes. Certain assignment descriptions are incorrect. Gives little to no direction. You will have to do some searching and reaching out just to find out what is due. Worst summer class ever.

The class isn't hard, but this guy is a nightmare. Doesn't explain directions clearly & never once posted an announcement in D2L to clarify. Only answered individual emails, so students had to tell each other when assignments were optional & when due dates changed. Lectures off PowerPoint slides. Grading criteria was very unclear & varied on D2L.

Easy A but instructions are confusing and inconsistent with syllabus. Module assignments are long (just do the bare minimum), discussion posts, 4 exams, 16 quizzes, & a group project. Do well on assignments & you can basically skip the group project & still make an A. Don't take with a heavy class load, you will barely have time for anything else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: The material is easy but he himself admits that there is too much homework; he says it's due to him using Connect and he may stop using it. The lectures are kind of dry. Sometimes instructions are unclear but he will work with you to fix it. Attendance was not mandatory but he says it will be next semester!
He is not very clear and was not very accessible outside of class

Never heard from professor. Unclear materials and assignments. No date listed for half the assignments... seriously he's awful. BUT the class is an easy A if you just do the work. 3 tests, HW, learnsmart, and quizzes. You have to motivate yourself and keep yourself on track because he sure isn't going to do it. You can get an A but you won't learn.
He is a good online professor. Easy grader, clear instructions, and the entire semester to get the work done (nothing was due til the last day of class so work at your own pace).
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: EASY! HIGHLY RECOMMEND! 13 Modules, 16 Discussion posts, 16 timed Quizzes, 3 Exams & Comprehensive Final. You do need the textbook. I know it sounds like a lot, however, VERY DOABLE and EASY. Can be time consuming that's all. All modules consists of end of chapter review questions, 1 or 2 Case Study, a quiz and Exercises.

In this online course there is a module each week that contains 1 or 2 chapters. For each chapter there is a quiz, a discussion post, a set of review questions, occasionally a set of exercises, and you are required to write 10 one-page case analysis'. Lots of busy work, but very easy to get an A.

One of the easiest online classes you could take. Same assignments due each week, all the answers to homework, quizzes, and tests can be found online. You will need the textbook, but only for homework questions. Easy A, just do the work on time. Professor is kind of MIA, but you don't really need him anyways.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took this professor online. His instructions for assignments, grading, deadlines, etc were extremely unclear. Anytime myself or a fellow classmate emailed him with questions it would take weeks to receive a very unclear response. He gave me a C even though I earned a B mathematically. He called me pissed because I copied his boss in an email.

ALL online business teachers are disorganized, so expect the same here. However, this professor is generous enough to hand out his personal cell & responds quickly to any questions you have. It's a shame lots of students rate him poorly because they'd rather complain to peers than text him or are too lazy to read ALL the directions for assignments.

IDK why he has low ratings. Took him online for 4003. Lots of busy work but do the work and get an A. He responds to texts in a few hours, not the best to email. Test questions are all searchable. EASY A.

The class itself is not hard, however this professor made it very difficult and confusing. He assigns a lot of homework, some for the grade and some are not and it is up to you to figure out what is optional and what is not. His tests consist of 2 parts: problems and short answers. Tests and homework are nothing alike. Don't take him.

The reason this is hard is because the professor is absolutely nonexistent and worthless. He emailed us at 2am ranting because we all reported him to the department head. He has extremely difficult exams with no tools to succeed. DO NOT TAKE HIM! Especially in the summer. The whole class has been miserable.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This is the worst online professor I have ever had. It's half way through the summer semester and he is nowhere to be found. His tests come form no where, and we have to ask our advisers to get him to answer our questions. He should either be trained how to teach classes online or fired. Might be good in class, but never take online only
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Obeidat was truly a wonderful professor who cared about his student's success in his class.  There were definitely more than a few homework assignments, but necessary to cover the material.  He was an extremely fair grader and made accommodations to whole class to get work done.  One of the best professors by far!

Professor was basically nonexistent the entire semester - no responses to emails, discussion board posts, etc . The exams were extremely difficult, and he had to curve the entire class for every exam. I wouldn't take him again, he made the class more stressful then it needed to be,

This is the worst online class I have ever taken. Professor did not answer emails or questions on discussion board. Did not follow the syllabus he posted at all. Randomly changed due dates without notifying the class. Assignments were sometimes missing, duplicated on D2L and Connect. Also assigns way too much work.

I took the class as an elective for my major (MET). There's too much busy work. You end up spending your time trying to get the work done instead of actually learning the material. The work isn't that hard and neither is the class. There's just too much work  to do which makes it hard to actually focus on learning the material.

There is way more work to do than there should be. Took it over the summer, normally have 2 chapters a week with discussions, review questions, exercises, quizzes, & case analysis for each chapter. Don't take this class if you have a heavy class load already. That being said, if you can get the work done, it's not that hard of a class.
Be prepared to do a TON of homework.  Test questions aren't always clear cut.  Be cautious taking this class if you have a heavy load.  You won't pass without the textbook.
He is very helpful and pragmatic. You can take his classes as much as you can :)

1st of all, there is alot of work involved. Each chp. Review Questions,Excercises, Case studies & Quizes. He is very fair and tries to help the class pass. If you are fine with the workload, TAKE HIM.Otherwise, get out of the burning kitchen if you cnt stand d heat.
This professor has high standards and he expects a lot from students. I put a great deal of work into the class but I also got a lot out of it.
He is the best professor.
He is a great professor

very easy to understand, problem is that there is way too much busy work for a 3hr credit class. Chapter review questions (usually 10), Exercise questions, and a case study which has to follow his template (usually 3 pages long) every week. Lots of busy work. He teaches from PPTs all day, very rare do we have class discussions. Ok professor.
